xml.p: Abigail: The valley looks more interesting in the rain... don't you think? #!String
Robin: The rain doesn't stop me from getting a job done!$h#$e#Although soggy wood isn't a joy to work with.$s #!String
Demetrius: Greetings. Stay inside if you want to keep warm. #!String
Maru: When it rains I have a good excuse to work on my gadgets all day.$h#$e#It must be kind of boring for you, though. #!String
Sebastian: If you're lucky, you might see a frog in this weather. #!String
Linus: A warm rain is a pleasant way to get clean.$h #!String
Pierre: Most people stay indoors on days like this... It's not good for business.$s #!String
Caroline: My garden is happy today.$h#$e#...and our water bill will be lower this month. #!String
Alex: Hmmph. This is not good weather for sports.$s#$e#Oh well, I can always lift weights inside.$h #!String
George: It's awful cold, isn't it? What a rotten day. #!String
Evelyn: When I woke up I heard dripping from somewhere... I think the roof might be leaking.$s#$e#In the old days, George would've scampered right up and fixed it... *sigh*$s #!String
Lewis: Hi there, @. Taking a break?#$e#I hope the river doesn't overflow...$s #!String
Clint: Today would be a good day to explore the mines... Who knows, you might find some rare ores. #!String
Penny: The raindrops are really loud on the metal roof of our trailer.#$e#...It's soothing, though.$h #!String
Pam: Howdy, kid. Stayin' dry? #!String
Emily: It never rains in Calico Desert... That's where my friend Sandy lives.#$e#I wish I could've visited her today.$s #!String
Haley: I spent all morning doing my hair... now the rain could mess it up.$s#$e#*sigh* ... Life is hard sometimes. #!String
Jodi: Did you wipe your boots off before coming in? Sorry... I just cleaned the floor.#$e#But you're always welcome in here! Heh.$h #!String
Sam: Rain muffles sound, so I can play my guitar louder without my Mom getting mad. Hehe.$h #!String
Leah: Maybe I should cook something new and exciting today. Something spicy. #!String
Shane: Hmm... this weather makes me thirsty.$s #!String
Marnie: Hi @. You look like you're soaked...you poor thing!$h #!String
Elliott: Sometimes when I lay in bed I can hear a distant foghorn cut through the rain.#$b#But when I look out the window I see only a curtain of gray. #!String
Gus: There's nothing like a glass of dry red wine on a day like this, huh?#$e#I love my job. Hehehe. #!String
Dwarf: Rain... It's almost mythical to us. Some of us dwarves live our entire lives without ever experiencing it. #!String
Wizard: Stormy days are the only time I can commune with certain elementals.#$e#I don't expect you to understand. #!String
Harvey: Hi @! Er... Read anything interesting in the library lately?#$e#Heh. Well, um... I'll see you around then?$u #!String
Sandy: I heard it's raining back home. Is that why you came here?$h#$e#I kind of miss the rain, actually...$s #!String
Krobus: Ah, the sewers are flowing quickly today. It'll get nice and humid in here... Just how I like it. #!String
Leo: The valley is peaceful when it rains.#$e#To me... nature is someone I know, with different moods. #!String
